{{about|the South Korean singer|the American singer|The Tamperer featuring Maya}}{{Distinguish|Mýa}}{{BLP sources|date=April 2014}} {{Korean name|Kim}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2020}} {{Infobox person | name = Maya | image = | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=y|1979|11|17}} | birth_place = South Korea | occupation = Singer, actress | years_active = 2003–present | agent = | alma_mater = [[Seoul Institute of the Arts]] | website = | module = {{Infobox musical artist | embed=yes | background = solo_singer | genre = Rock | instrument = Vocals }} | module2 = {{Infobox Korean name|child=yes| | hangul = 김영숙 | hanja = | rr = Gim Yeong-suk | mr = Kim Yŏngsuk | hangulstage = 마야 | rrstage = Ma-ya | mrstage = Ma-ya }} }} '''Kim Young-sook''' ([[Hangul]]: 김영숙; born 17 November 1979), better known by her stage name, '''Maya''' (Hangul: 마야) is a South Korean singer and actress.{{Cite web|url=http://world.kbs.co.kr/english/program/program_artist_detail.htm?No=105985|title=Maya (마야)|website=KBS World Radio|access-date=14 April 2018}} She debuted in 2003 with the album, ''Born To Do It'', which included the hit song, "Azalea."{{Cite news|url=http://news.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2017/11/27/2017112700951.html|title=가수 마야, 근황은? '복면가왕 나와주세요'|date=27 November 2017|work=The Chosun Ilbo|access-date=14 April 2018|language=ko}} ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" ! scope="col" rowspan="2" | Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2" | Album details ! scope="col" colspan="1" style="width:5em;" | Peak chart positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2" | Sales |- ! KOR
{{Cite web|url=http://www.miak.or.kr:80/navigator.php?contents=html&usemode=list&DB=117|title=K-Pop Album Sales Volume|website=Recording Industry Association of Korea|language=ko|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090219201306/http://www.miak.or.kr/navigator.php?contents=html&usemode=list&DB=117|archive-date=19 February 2009|url-status=dead|access-date=14 April 2018}} |- ! scope="row" |''Born To Do It'' | *Released: 26 February 2003 *Label: Seoul Entertainment *Formats: CD, [[Compact Cassette|cassette]] |46 | *KOR: 6,825+{{Cite web|url=http://www.miak.or.kr:80/stat/kpop_200302.htm|title=February 2003 K-Pop Album Sales Volume|website=Recording Industry Association of Korea|language=ko|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20050323193020/http://www.miak.or.kr/stat/kpop_200302.htm|archive-date=23 March 2005|url-status=dead|access-date=14 April 2018}} |- ! scope="row" |''Rock Star'' | *Released: 13 May 2004 *Label: Seoul Entertainment *Formats: CD, cassette |9 | *KOR: 20,916+{{Cite web|url=http://www.miak.or.kr:80/stat/kpop_200406.htm|title=July 2004 K-Pop Album Sales Volume|website=Recording Industry Association of Korea|language=ko|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081112053445/http://www.miak.or.kr/stat/kpop_200406.htm|archive-date=12 November 2008|url-status=dead|access-date=14 April 2018}} |- ! scope="row" |''Girls Generation'' (소녀시대) | *Released: 1 July 2005 *Label: Seoul Entertainment *Formats: CD, cassette | 7 | *KOR: 61,636+{{Cite web|url=http://miak.or.kr:80/stat/kpop_2005.htm|title=2005 Total K-Pop Album Sales Volume|website=Recording Industry Association of Korea|language=ko|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090228163338/http://miak.or.kr/stat/kpop_2005.htm|archive-date=28 February 2009|url-status=live|access-date=14 April 2018}} |- ! scope="row" |''Road To Myself'' | *Released: 9 November 2006 *Label: Seoul Entertainment *Formats: CD, cassette |12 | *KOR: 9,106+{{Cite web|url=http://miak.or.kr:80/stat/Kpop_200612.htm|title=December 2006 K-Pop Album Sales Volume|website=Recording Industry Association of Korea|language=ko|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090228162929/http://miak.or.kr/stat/Kpop_200612.htm|archive-date=28 February 2009|url-status=live|access-date=14 April 2018}} |- ! scope="row" |''Maya Four'' | *Released: 8 April 2008 *Label: [[List of Sony Music Entertainment labels|Sony]] *Formats: CD, cassette | 23 | *KOR: 3,635+{{Cite web|url=http://www.miak.or.kr:80/stat/kpop_200804.htm|title=April 2008 K-Pop Album Sales Volume|website=Recording Industry Association of Korea|language=ko|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090211040727/http://www.miak.or.kr/stat/kpop_200804.htm|archive-date=11 February 2009|url-status=dead|access-date=14 April 2018}} |- |} ==Filmography== ===Television=== *''[[Bodyguard (2003 TV series)|Bodyguard]]'' ([[KBS2]], 2003) *''Nursery Story'' ([[Munhwa Broadcasting Corporation|MBC]], 2003) *''[[:ko:매직 (드라마)|Magic]]'' ([[Seoul Broadcasting System|SBS]], 2004) *''[[Family's Honor (TV series)|Family's Honor]]'' (SBS, 2008) *''[[Dandelion Family]]'' (MBC, 2010) *''[[Dream of the Emperor]]'' ([[KBS1]], 2012) *''[[Ugly Alert]]'' (SBS, 2013) ===Film=== *''What Is Natural?'' (2003) ==Awards and nominations== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year ! Award ! Category ! Nominated work ! Result |- | rowspan=4|2003 | [[2003 Mnet Asian Music Awards|5th]] [[Mnet Asian Music Awards]]{{cite web|title=MAMA 2003 Winners' Profile & MV |url=http://mama.interest.me/history?type=winner&year=2003 |website=Mwave |accessdate=12 June 2014 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121029010721/http://mama.interest.me/history?type=winner&year=2003 |archivedate=29 October 2012 }} | [[Mnet Asian Music Award for Best New Artist (Solo or Group)|Best New Female Artist]] | ''Azalea'' | {{won}} |- | 18th [[Golden Disk Award]]s | Best Pop Award | | {{won}} |- | 14th [[Seoul Music Awards]] | Best New Artist | | {{won}} |- | [[KBS Drama Awards]] | Best New Actress | ''[[Bodyguard (2003 TV series)|Bodyguard]]'' | {{won}} |- | 2009 | [[2009 SBS Drama Awards|SBS Drama Awards]] | Best Supporting Actress in a Special Planning Drama | ''[[Family's Honor (TV series)|Family's Honor]]'' | {{nom}} |- | 2010 | [[2010 MBC Drama Awards|MBC Drama Awards]] | Best New Actress | ''[[Dandelion Family]]'' | {{nom}} |- |} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{HanCinema person}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Maya}} [[Category:1979 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Place of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:South Korean female singers]] [[Category:South Korean pop rock singers]] [[Category:South Korean television actresses]] [[Category:South Korean film actresses]] [[Category:Mnet Asian Music Award winners]] [[Category:21st-century South Korean singers]] [[Category:21st-century women singers]] {{SouthKorea-singer-stub}}
